availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis A. Bradshaw (Adair County, Kentucky, student, farmer, and soldier)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, student, farmer, and soldier. Adair County, Kentucky, native. Son of Alban Bradshaw and Mary Bradshaw. Student in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Adair County in 1850. Farmer in Adair County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Adair County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal from December 31, 1861 to January 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 95B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 126.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 2B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0263.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 857.
